page.title: 04OLD BUILDINGS
page.content: {Two very old houses}stand out as worth a mention. {Poplars Farm}on the A46 dates mainly from{1661}and a sundial on the south wall links it with the Gwinnett family who also erected an identical sundial dated 1665 on the south wall of the Parish Church. The farm building is now derelict, the subject of a{preservation order,}but the owner cannot be traced. {Church Farm}is part timber-framed, has been well maintained and dates from the{late 17th century.}It is still a thriving farm. Other old properties, late 18th century, early 19th century, are centred mainly around the junction of the A46 and Leckhampton Lane and some are scattered along the A46 to the south of this junction.
